title: Environmental Econ I
description: Topics include externalities, property rights, incentive design, emission taxes, tradable emission permits, renewable and nonrenewable resources, innovation incentives originating with environmental regulations and globalization, trans-boundary polluntants within and across nations, international environmental agreements, and the globalization impacts on the environment.
restrictions: __HEADER_0__Cannot be enrolled in one of the following Levels:
__HEADER_1__Must be enrolled in one of the following Campuses:
prerequisites: ECON 7013 Graduate Semester Minimum Grade of D and ECON 7015 Graduate Semester Minimum Grade of D and ECON 7031 Graduate Semester Minimum Grade of D and ECON 7032 Graduate Semester Minimum Grade of D
